title.native: ライザのアトリエ ～常闇の女王と秘密の隠れ家～
title.romaji: Ryza no Atelier: Tokoyami no Joou to Himitsu no Kakurega
title.english: Atelier Ryza: Ever Darkness & the Secret Hideout The Animation

description:
The village of Rasenboden lies on Kurken Island, which is surrounded by a lake. Time travels slowly on this island that's on the outskirts of the Roteswasser Kingdom. In this quiet little village with very little excitement lived Ryza, a girl with entirely too much energy for this quiet village, whose main feature was that she's so ordinary that she has no outstanding features.

"Sigh... I wonder if there's anything interesting to do..."

Ryza wasn't satisfied with solely being known as an ordinary farmer's daughter in the uptight, boring little village. So one day, she sneaks onto a boat with her childhood friends Lent and Tao, and they have their first adventure to the opposite shore. There, she encounters a man who uses a mysterious power called alchemy. Ryza is completely enchanted by this power and asks him to teach it to her. From an ordinary farmer's daughter to an alchemist... This was something completely new. Their own little single summer adventure is about to begin—

(Source: Crunchyroll)

Note: The first episode aired with a runtime of ~48 minutes.
synonyms: อเทลิเยร์ ไรซ่า: ราชินีแห่งรัตติกาลและที่ซ่อนลับ
Ателье Райзы: Царица вечной тьмы и тайное убежище

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

tags.name: Iyashikei
tags.description: Primary aim is to heal the audience through serene depictions of characters' daily lives.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomos12)

He started working at Studio Deen, where he made his debut as animator in an episode of Dai Guard. After leaving Deen he became freelance and works mainly on productions for J.C.Staff but also on some titles for Bones, Gonzo and Feel. He is particularly renowned as bishoujo animator, since he tends to pay attention to detailed character appearance and traits for girls, as well as providing his characters cute and bashful gestures.

Kazuki Yanagawa (柳川 和樹) is a Japanese composer renowned for his contributions to video game music, particularly within the Atelier series developed by GUST Co., Ltd. Born on September 9, 1986, in Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan, Yanagawa has established himself as a prominent figure in the realm of game composition.

He joined Gust after graduating from university. His first work at Gust was Ar Tonelico III along with Ken Nakagawa. His first work for the Atelier series was Atelier Totori, also with Ken Nakagawa.

In June 2011, he left Gust and became a freelancer. He continued to compose music for Gust. In 2014, he returned to Gust's sound team and worked on Ar Nosurge. On February 22nd, 2017, he announced that he retired from Koei Tecmo's Gust. 
Now, he works as a freelancer but continues to compose music for the Atelier series, maintaining his musical influence in the franchise’s latest titles.

name.native: 株式会社コーエーテクモホールディングス

node.description: KOEI TECMO GAMES is a Japanese video game and anime holding company created in 2009 by the merger of Koei and Tecmo.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fujimari_617) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/藤田まり子)

A Japanese animator and designer.

[Official Site](https://www.phantasia.jp/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/3pasiofficial/) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5WmX340gDNLIAyUcg4MzWN) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/3_phantasia) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC4lk0Ob-F3ptOQUUq8s0pzQ)

Sangatsu no Phantasia is a Japanese music unit which is signed to Sacra Music. It consists of vocalist [Mia](https://anilist.co/staff/272155/Mia), whose music videos and promotional images are illustrated by various artists. The unit began activities in 2015 when it uploaded its first song "Day Break" on YouTube, before making its major debut in 2016. In addition to producing music, Mia also writes novels, with some of the unit's songs being based on her novels.

**Members:** 

- Vocals: [Mia](https://anilist.co/staff/272155/Mia)
- Composer: [Scop](https://twitter.com/scopscop)
- Illustrator: [Natsu Asami](https://twitter.com/72desuyo)
- Composer: [n-buna](https://twitter.com/nabuna2)
- Composer: [Yuuyu](https://twitter.com/yuuyu_ssry)
- Composer: [40mp](https://twitter.com/40mP)
- Composer: [buzz-G](https://twitter.com/buzz_g)

Harumaki Gohan is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer, music producer, animator, illustrator and character designer.
